conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D, E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Point A is located at the top left, Point B is in the middle, and Point C is at the top right. Containers D, E, F, and G are at the bottom.
There are multiple baffles in the image: horizontal, diagonal, and vertical, which direct the flow of liquid.
Point A has a vertical path leading down to a horizontal baffle.
Liquid from Point A flows vertically down until it hits the top horizontal baffle.
At the horizontal baffle, liquid from Point A turns right due to the orientation of the baffle.
Liquid from Point A continues downward along the baffle and encounters another horizontal baffle.
The second horizontal baffle directs liquid from Point A further right.
Liquid from Point A flows into container F.
Point B has a vertical path leading down to a horizontal baffle.
Liquid from Point B flows vertically down until it hits the top horizontal baffle.
At the horizontal baffle, liquid from Point B turns right due to the orientation of the baffle.
Liquid from Point B continues downward along the baffle and encounters another horizontal baffle.
The second horizontal baffle directs liquid from Point B further right.
Liquid from Point B flows into container G.
Point C has a vertical path leading down to a horizontal baffle.
Liquid from Point C flows vertically down until it hits the top horizontal baffle.
At the horizontal baffle, liquid from Point C turns left due to the orientation of the baffle.
Liquid from Point C continues downward along the baffle and encounters another horizontal baffle.
The second horizontal baffle directs liquid from Point C further left.
Liquid from Point C flows into container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A flows into container F, liquid from B flows into container G, and liquid from C flows into container E.
